messages.content: How can i run a gui application on linux when i do not have a screen. I need to test application but it would not start

You can run a GUI application on Linux without a screen by using a virtual machine that has a graphical user interface (GUI) and a way to connect to the virtual machine over a network. This can be done using VirtualBox or VMWare.
Here are the steps to do this:
1. Download a Linux distribution that has a GUI and a graphical user interface. For example, you can use Ubuntu or any other Linux distribution that has a graphical user interface.
2. Install the Linux distribution on a virtual machine using a virtualization software such as VirtualBox or VMWare.
3. Once the virtual machine is up and running, connect to it using a remote desktop client such as Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) or VNC.
4. Run the GUI application on the virtual machine using the remote desktop client. You can do this by setting up a connection from your local machine to the virtual machine and then launching the application from within the virtual machine.
5. Once you have tested the application, you can exit the virtual machine and connect back to your local machine.
Note that the performance of the GUI application may be slower in a virtual machine compared to the performance of the same application running directly on the physical machine. Additionally, you may need to install additional software or drivers on the virtual machine to enable the GUI application to run properly.

If you are trying to run a graphical user interface (GUI) application on a Linux system without a physical display, you may not be able to do so directly using a virtual machine. This is because a virtual machine is designed to run on a physical machine, and the hardware required to run a GUI application such as a display may not be available in a virtual machine.
However, you may be able to use a virtualization software such as VirtualBox or VMWare to run a Linux distribution that has a graphical user interface (GUI) and a graphical user interface (GUI) application. In this case, you would need to install the Linux distribution on a physical machine and then install the graphical user interface (GUI) application on the virtual machine.
Once the virtual machine is up and running, you can connect to it using a remote desktop client such as VirtualBox or VMWare and start the GUI application. You can then run the application just like you would on a physical machine.
Note that the performance of the GUI application may be slower in a virtual machine compared to the performance of the same application running directly on the physical machine. Additionally, you may need to install additional software or drivers on the virtual machine to enable the GUI application to run properly.
